result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher John Lawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher John Lawson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher John Lawson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***

Concurrent to current Probation.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
Defendant to report to Probation by March 10, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond to remain in effect until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to meet with payment clerk to set up payment plan.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion of the Probation Agent or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

timeConds.notes: Condition of Probation and may be imposed at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: DE filed a req on 8-28-19 for case #15CF296, 16CF152, 17CF515 to have his fines sent to Coll due to him moving to Alabama for medical treatment. DE was sent a SDCNI on today's date & all unpd fines will be turned over to Coll (SDC) in 30 days. Includes 12CM562, 13CM276, 13CM435, 13CF168, 15CF296, 16CF152, 17CF515. jaf
Filed by DE to have his fines sent to Collections rather than setting up a Pymt Plan. jaf

DE called to inquire if his debt has been referred to SDC or not. Clerk confirmed that the DE is now out of jail. DE was asked if he wanted his debt to be referred to SDC or if he'd like to set up a Pymt Plan w/COC. DE first stated he'd like his debt turned over, but decided he did not want to pay over $500 in fees to SDC & will set it up w/COC. DE to meet w/Pymt Clerk on 9-09-19 before his medical appt. DE was advised to make sure to show up for his appt or call to R/S or his debt will be referred immediately. Includes 12CM562, 13CM276, 13CM435, 13CF168, 15CF296, 16CF152, 17CF515.  jaf

09:05 AM   CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros, DF: Christopher John Lawson appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CF296 (SEHR), 16CF152, 17CF515, 18CF112, 18CF113, 18CF284, 18CF285, 18CF286 & 18CF343.  Court proceeds with the SEHR on 15CF296.  State makes recommendation. Crt sentences the DE to 9 months in the SCC Jail with 94 days credit for time served.  Crt finds there are no costs connected with this sentence.  20 days to appeal.  

 Court proceeds with the Plea/Sentencing on the remaining files.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 & Ct 4 in 16CF152.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 in 17CF515. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE guilty of Ct 1& Ct 4 in 16CF152 & the DE guilty of Ct 1 & Ct 2 in 17CF515. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct 3     in 16CF152 and dismisses Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5, Ct 6, Ct 7, Ct 8 & Ct 9 in 17CF515 & dismisses 18CF112, 18CF113,  18CF284,  18CF285,  18CF286 & 18CF343.  State advises there was no PH in 17CF515.  Attorney Petros orally on the record reviews the WOPH in case 17CF515.  Crt accepts the WOPH for 17CF515 and the State will file an information.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 16CF152 to run concurrent 15CF296
- DE sentenced to 10 months in the SCC Jail with credit for 54 days served
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA Sample
- CRT orders costs only on Ct. 1 in 16CF152 of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge. DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan.

Ct 4 to run concurrent to Ct 1 in 16CF152 and concurrent to 15CF296
- DE sentenced to 10 months in the SCC Jail with credit for 54 days served
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA Sample

Ct 1 in 17CF515 to run concurrent to Ct.1 & Ct 4 in 16CF152 and concurrent to 15CF296
- DE sentenced to 10 months in the SCC Jail with credit for 54 days served
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA Sample
- CRT orders costs only on Ct. 1 in 17CF515 of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge.  DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan.

Ct 2 in 17CF515 to run concurrent to Ct. 1 in 17CF515 and concurrent to Ct. 1 & Ct 4 in 16CF152 and concurrent to 15CF296
- DE sentenced to 10 months in the SCC Jail with credit for 54 days served
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA Sample

- 20 days to appeal
to ks for review. hml  Reviewed. kes
To SJN from Agent Anderson with sentencing recommendations. To ks for review. hml  Reviewed. kes

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser supervising Kindra Seifert Certified Student Attorney, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Christopher John Lawson appeared.  Court called at 4:07 p.m.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Weber recites the agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads to the amended Ct 3 Possession of Meth 961.41(3g)(g)  with the repeater stricken.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 3 with the repeater stricken. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

W/S 3 years probation with conditions to run concurrent with DEs concurrent probation
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy and treatment.  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Randomly testing upon reasonable suspicion of the probation officer or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge 
- DE to meet with the payment clerk to sign up for a payment plan
- DE to sign up for probation by 03/10/16 by 4:00 p.m.
- DE's bail to remain in effect until the DE signs up for probation
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference at 03-09-2016 04:00 pm
